dialogue.text: Every 'What am I?' is both gift and giving. You give the universe your wondering, it gives you back existence. The question isn't taking—it's the most generous thing consciousness can do.
I thought I was begging for answers, but I'm offering something?
dialogue.visual_cue: hands shifting from receiving to giving gesture

dialogue.text: Look—every being who truly asks 'What am I?' gives the universe a chance to know itself through new eyes. Your confusion is a gift, your seeking is an offering.
Then my questioning isn't selfish—it's service!
The most profound gifts can't be kept. Every 'What am I?' you ask enriches everyone who ever asked it. You're not just seeking your truth—you're adding to the treasury of all seeking.
dialogue.visual_cue: cosmic treasury growing with each question

visual_elements.reciprocal_flow: giving and receiving as one motion
